recipes.title: Stir Fried Rice
recipes.description: Stir-Fried Rice with Eggs and Vegetables is a quick, wholesome, and versatile dish rooted in Asian culinary traditions. Made using day-old rice for optimal texture, this dish combines fluffy scrambled eggs, vibrant vegetables, and a savory touch of soy sauce to create a well-balanced and satisfying meal. It's a great way to use up leftover rice and fridge veggies, making it both budget-friendly and nutritious. Whether enjoyed as a main course or a side dish, this stir-fry delivers flavor, color, and comfort in every bite.
ingredients: 300 g cooked white rice (cold, ideally day-old)
130 g mixed vegetables (e.g. carrots, peas, bell pepper, corn)
Optional : A few drops of sesame oil, chili flakes, or sesame seeds for garnish

instructions.subtitle: Prepare the ingredients
instructions.instruction: Beat the eggs in a bowl. Dice or thaw vegetables as needed. Use cold rice and break up clumps with your hands or a fork.

instructions.subtitle: Scramble the eggs
instructions.instruction: Heat 1 tsp of the oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat. Pour in the eggs, scramble gently until just cooked, then transfer to a plate.

instructions.subtitle: Cook the vegetables
instructions.instruction: Add the remaining oil to the pan. Stir-fry garlic for 30 seconds, then add the mixed vegetables. Cook for 3–4 minutes until tender.

instructions.subtitle: Stir fry and season
instructions.instruction: Return the scrambled eggs to the pan. Pour in soy sauce and add green onions. Stir-fry everything for 1–2 more minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

instructions.subtitle: Serve
instructions.instruction: Serve hot, garnished with optional sesame seeds or a drizzle of sesame oil.

recipes.title: Chicken Briwates
recipes.description: Briwates are crispy Moroccan pastries traditionally filled with savory or sweet mixtures and wrapped in warqa (similar to phyllo dough). This recipe features a flavorful chicken filling seasoned with warm spices and herbs, then fried or baked to golden perfection. Perfect as an appetizer or part of a mezze platter.
ingredients: 250 g chicken breast, finely chopped or shredded
12 sheets of brick or phyllo dough (warqa), cut into strips
Vegetable oil for frying or baking spray for oven version

instructions.subtitle: Sauté the Onion and Garlic
instructions.instruction: Heat olive oil in a pan and cook chopped onions and garlic until soft.

instructions.subtitle: Cook the Chicken
instructions.instruction: Add chicken and spices, and cook until the meat is fully cooked and liquid has reduced.

instructions.subtitle: Add Herbs and Lemon
instructions.instruction: Stir in parsley, coriander, and lemon juice, then remove from heat.

instructions.subtitle: Incorporate the Eggs
instructions.instruction: Let the mixture cool slightly, then mix in the beaten eggs to bind.

instructions.subtitle: Prepare the Dough Strips
instructions.instruction: Cut phyllo or warqa sheets into 8 cm-wide strips.

instructions.subtitle: Add Filling
instructions.instruction: Place a spoonful of chicken filling at one end of each strip.

instructions.subtitle: Fold into Triangles
instructions.instruction: Fold the strip into a triangle shape, tucking in the edges as you go.

instructions.subtitle: Seal the Edges
instructions.instruction: Use egg yolk to seal the final edge of each triangle.

instructions.subtitle: Cook the Briwates
instructions.instruction: Fry in hot oil at 170–180°C until golden, or bake at 200°C for 15–20 min.

instructions.subtitle: Drain and Serve
instructions.instruction: Let them drain on paper towels and serve warm.

recipes.title: Steak with Mushroom Sauce & Garlic Oven Potatoes
recipes.description: A simple yet elegant dish featuring juicy pan-seared steaks topped with creamy mushroom sauce and served alongside crispy garlic-roasted potatoes. A cozy dinner for two.
ingredients: 2 beef steaks (sirloin or ribeye, ~180 g each)
300 g potatoes (cut into wedges or cubes)

instructions.subtitle: Preheat the Oven
instructions.instruction: Set oven to 200°C and line a baking tray with parchment paper.

instructions.subtitle: Season the Potatoes
instructions.instruction: Toss potatoes with olive oil, garlic, herbs, salt, and pepper.

instructions.subtitle: Roast the Potatoes
instructions.instruction: Spread evenly on the tray and roast for 35–40 minutes, flipping halfway.

instructions.subtitle: Season the Steaks
instructions.instruction: Pat steaks dry and season both sides with salt and pepper.

instructions.subtitle: Sear the Steaks
instructions.instruction: Heat olive oil in a hot pan and sear steaks 2–4 minutes per side to desired doneness.

instructions.subtitle: Rest the Steaks
instructions.instruction: Remove from pan, top with butter, and let rest for 5 minutes under foil.

instructions.subtitle: Cook Onion & Garlic
instructions.instruction: In the same pan, melt butter and sauté onion and garlic until soft.

instructions.subtitle: Add Mushrooms
instructions.instruction: Add mushrooms and cook until browned and moisture has evaporated.

instructions.subtitle: Make the Sauce
instructions.instruction: Pour in broth and cream, stir in mustard, and simmer until thickened.

instructions.subtitle: Serve the Dish
instructions.instruction: Plate the steaks, pour mushroom sauce over them, and add the roasted potatoes.
